intro: Cyperus compressus subsp. micranthus, commonly known as the narrowleaf sedges, is a flowering plant belonging to the sedge family (Cyperaceae). It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with slender, erect stems and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flower heads that are typically wind-pollinated. It is often found in wetland or marshy environments, thriving in moist soils. Its ecological importance includes providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
